name: Stadium Surplus: Lombard 5-Panel Cap
description: Stadium Style The first Stadium+ product available is our Lombard 5-Panel, Denim / Suede / Genuine Leather 5-Panel caps. A simple, clean, understated style that will become your favorite, everyday piece. Features: The crown is a black cotton denim twill, that features black enamel grommets. The center front of the crown includes a genuine leather patch, with a silver foil deboss logo. A black suede brim, with black topstitching finishes off the front of the hat. The back features a black leather strap, with a polished silver adjustment buckle. The Story: Lombard is a street in North Portland that runs East to West, and goes right through the neighborhood we live in -- an artery in working-class Portland. North Portland was the centerpiece of an industrial district at the turn of the century. We wanted to highlight the blue-collar, industrial center of early Portland by using a palette of materials that are reminiscent of that time period, but done in a modern way. The different depths and textural differences create interest in a monochromatic color story, to create a simple, yet luxe feel. Additional Info: One size fits all

name: US Military Desert Night Camo Fishtail Parka
description: Circa: 1990s Description: Interesting United States Military Desert Night camo parka from The Gulf War. This particular pattern was designed with the intent to hide soldiers from older generation Night Vision Devices (NVDs). Full length parka includes fish tail hem with drawcord adjustment at back. Sleeve cuffs are fold over with inner elastic. 2-piece hood with drawcord adjustment and button-up storm flap with hidden buttons. Drawcord waist adjustment. 2 pocket openings in front allow access to inner jacket and gear. Articulated sleeves at elbows for increased mobility. Overall, this is one bad ass jacket, in a rare camo pattern that has been phased out by the US Military. Measurements: Chest - Fits 21-22" Length - 37" (Front), 39" (Back) Sleeve Length - 26" Label: Selma Apparel US Stock No: 8415-01-102-6279 Size on Label: Small Origin: Made in USA Material: 50% Cotton / 50% Nylon Condition: Very lightly used. name: Authentic ZZ Top Recycler Tour Merch Tee '90
description: Circa: 1990 We found it, we loved it, we had to share it with you. ZZ Top released their 10th album, "Recycler" in 1990 and continued their classic rock anthems with hits like "Concrete and Steel" and "My Head's In Mississippi". Description: This shirt is hanging on to dear life and is in very rough condition, but we couldn't just let it go to waste and throw it away. Center front screen print graphic, features the album cover. Center back screen print graphic reads, "Recycler World Tour 1990". The left shoulder seam is apart, the seams at the underarms are also coming apart on the left sleeve, and there is a tear in the front lower left of the body as pictured. Hand feel is absolutely soft to the touch. Black color of body has faded through countless washes. We decided to put it in the store because there may be someone out there with some sentimental attachment to this particular tour/album or someone out there willing to modify this tee into a kick ass tank for the Summer. Measurements: Chest - 19" Length - 24" Label: Unknown Origin: Unknown Material: 100% Cotton Condition: Damaged. Still very usable for a DIY tank top project. Screen printed graphics are actually very sharp and show some signs of wear. Color is still very vivid and sharp. Sizing: Please take your measurements and confirm before purchasing. name: Emmylou Harris: Tour '85
description: Circa: 1985 Description: Authentic and original merch baseball tee from Emmylou Harris' 1985 tour, "The Ballad of Sally Rose". Famous country/folk names such as Waylon Jennings, Vince Gill, Dolly Parton, and Linda Ronstadt were all a part of the album and/or tour. Tee features 3/4 length sleeves with a deep burgundy contrast color, to a cream colored body. Center front print shows fading, but can still make out the album cover portrait, while back print is still vivid and full of color. Rounded drop hem with turned raw edge and single needle stitch to finish. Very soft and broken in. A rare piece of music history just in time for Summer. Measurements: Chest - 20" Length - 26" Label: Advertee's Size on Label: XL Origin: USA Condition: Overall shows signs of wear, light stains, and slight damage to back neck where it meets the back raglan seam. name: Robert Plant Now & Zen Tour '88
description: Circa: 1988 Description: Robert Plant founded a group called The Yardbirds which then became a little known band known as, Led Zepplin. After the passing of John Bonham and the break-up of Led Zepplin in 1980, Robert Plant had a successful solo career. In 1988 he released, "Now and Zen" and toured the US and UK, eventually hitting Oregon, and the Memorial Coliseum in June of '88. This t-shirt was tracked down in Portland, Oregon and probably was purchased at that time during his tour. The t-shirt features a prominent front screen print, as well as a large back screen print. The shirt has been broken in and is very lightweight and has a lot of drape. The print has almost no hand, and is absolutely in great shape. There are signs of wear, and stains, but overall the t-shirt has survived almost 25 years. Truly a fully fledged, authentic Rock n Roll tee that cannot be replicated. Measurements: Chest - 23.5" Length - 25" Label: HandTex Size on Label: OS Origin: USA Material: 50% Polyster, 50% Cotton Condition: Signs of heavy wear, some stains and loose threads. Print is faded but in good condition. Print has almost no hand. Sizing: Please take your measurements and confirm before purchasing.
